intro: Pouzolzia fuscescens, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a member of the Polygonaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. It has a fibrous root system that helps it survive in poor soil conditions. The wood of Pouzolzia fuscescens is valued for its durability and is used in traditional crafts and construction.
